title: Scarf
data:
***Version [0.30](/0.30 "0.30")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

| Name                                                           | Scarf   |
| :------------------------------------------------------------- | ------- |
| Size to wear                                                   | Any     |
| [Armour Class](/Armour_class "Armour class")                   | 0       |
| [Encumbrance rating](/Encumbrance_rating "Encumbrance rating") | +0      |
| Maximum Enchantment                                            | +0      |
| Grants                                                         | nothing |
| Time to Wear                                                   | 5       |

|   |                                                                                                                                 |
| - | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | A length of stylish fabric. At its creation, enchantments were woven into it, and as such it cannot accept further enchantment. |

A **scarf** is a somewhat uncommon magical piece of [armour](/Armour "Armour") that occupies the [cloak](/Cloak "Cloak") slot. Unlike cloaks, they do not provide any [AC](/AC "AC") and cannot benefit from [scrolls of enchant armour](/Scrolls_of_enchant_armour "Scrolls of enchant armour").

Scarves will always spawn with an [ego](/Ego "Ego"), and can attain unique egos not found on regular cloaks.

## Egos

Scarves can appear with the following [egos](/Ego "Ego"):

- [Repulsion](/Repulsion "Repulsion") - reduces the chance of missile attacks hitting the wearer.
- [Resistance](/Resistance_\(ego\) "Resistance (ego)") - provides **rF+** and **rC+**.
- [Invisibility](/Invisibility_\(ego\) "Invisibility (ego)") - can be evoked to become invisible in exchange for HP [drain](/Drain "Drain").
- [Harm](/Harm "Harm") - increases damage dealt by 30% and damage received by 20%.
- [Shadows](/Shadows "Shadows") - reduces [LOS](/LOS "LOS") by 1 tile.

[Randart](/Randart "Randart") scarves will always spawn with these egos, too.

## Strategy

While providing no AC on their own, scarves can appear with unique and useful enchantments that may provide situational benefits. If your character has fairly high [AC](/AC "AC") already, it may be worth the sacrifice to provide multiple resistances or a means of repelling missiles.

## History

- Prior to [0.30](/0.30 "0.30"), scarves couldn't appear as [randarts](/Randart "Randart").
- In [0.26](/0.26 "0.26"), the [shadows](/Shadows "Shadows") ego was added.
- Prior to [0.25](/0.25 "0.25"), scarves could have the [Cloud immunity](/Cloud_immunity "Cloud immunity") and [Spirit shield](/Spirit_shield "Spirit shield") egos instead of [Invisibility](/Invisibility_\(ego\) "Invisibility (ego)") and [Harm](/Harm "Harm").
- Prior to [0.21](/0.21 "0.21"), scarves could appear as randarts. Randart scarves in 0.20 often spawned with cloak egos (instead of scarf-exclusive egos), essentially making them the same as a cloak.
- Scarves were added in [0.20](/0.20 "0.20").

html:
Scarf

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.30: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.
Name Scarf
Size to wear Any
Armour Class 0
Encumbrance rating +0
Maximum Enchantment +0
Grants nothing
Time to Wear 5


A length of stylish fabric. At its creation, enchantments were woven into it, and as such it cannot accept further enchantment.

A scarf is a somewhat uncommon magical piece of armour that occupies the cloak slot. Unlike cloaks, they do not provide any AC and cannot benefit from scrolls of enchant armour.

Scarves will always spawn with an ego, and can attain unique egos not found on regular cloaks.

Egos

Scarves can appear with the following egos:

  • Repulsion - reduces the chance of missile attacks hitting the wearer.
  • Resistance - provides rF+ and rC+.
  • Invisibility - can be evoked to become invisible in exchange for HP drain.
  • Harm - increases damage dealt by 30% and damage received by 20%.
  • Shadows - reduces LOS by 1 tile.

Randart scarves will always spawn with these egos, too.

Strategy

While providing no AC on their own, scarves can appear with unique and useful enchantments that may provide situational benefits. If your character has fairly high AC already, it may be worth the sacrifice to provide multiple resistances or a means of repelling missiles.

History

  • Prior to 0.30, scarves couldn't appear as randarts.
  • In 0.26, the shadows ego was added.
  • Prior to 0.25, scarves could have the Cloud immunity and Spirit shield egos instead of Invisibility and Harm.
  • Prior to 0.21, scarves could appear as randarts. Randart scarves in 0.20 often spawned with cloak egos (instead of scarf-exclusive egos), essentially making them the same as a cloak.
  • Scarves were added in 0.20.

{{Flavour|A length of stylish fabric. At its creation, enchantments were woven into it, and as such it cannot accept further enchantment.}}
A '''scarf''' is a somewhat uncommon magical piece of [[armour]] that occupies the [[cloak]] slot. Unlike cloaks, they do not provide any [[AC]] and cannot benefit from [[scrolls of enchant armour]].

Scarves will always spawn with an [[ego]], and can attain unique egos not found on regular cloaks.

==Egos==
Scarves can appear with the following [[ego]]s: 
*[[Repulsion]] - reduces the chance of missile attacks hitting the wearer.
*[[Resistance (ego)|Resistance]] - provides '''rF+''' and '''rC+'''.
*[[Invisibility (ego)|Invisibility]] - can be evoked to become invisible in exchange for HP [[drain]].
*[[Harm]] - increases damage dealt by 30% and damage received by 20%.
*[[Shadows]] - reduces [[LOS]] by 1 tile.

[[Randart]] scarves will always spawn with these egos, too.

==Strategy==
While providing no AC on their own, scarves can appear with unique and useful enchantments that may provide situational benefits. If your character has fairly high [[AC]] already, it may be worth the sacrifice to provide multiple resistances or a means of repelling missiles.

==History==
*Prior to [[0.30]], scarves couldn't appear as [[randart]]s.
*In [[0.26]], the [[shadows]] ego was added.
*Prior to [[0.25]], scarves could have the [[Cloud immunity]] and [[Spirit shield]] egos instead of [[Invisibility (ego)|Invisibility]] and [[Harm]].
*Prior to [[0.21]], scarves could appear as randarts. Randart scarves in 0.20 often spawned with cloak egos (instead of scarf-exclusive egos), essentially making them the same as a cloak.
*Scarves were added in [[0.20]].
